intro: Cyathea quindiuensis, commonly known as the Quindío huperzia, is a species of tree fern native to the Andes mountains in Colombia. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant exhibits a unique growth habit, with a short rhizome and a crown of feathery leaves that can reach several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
